text: I took office at a time when many around
the world had come to view America with
skepticism and distrust a part of this
was due to misperceptions and
misinformation about my country
Wednesday marked the opening of the 64th
annual gathering of world leaders in New
York and it was also the de Beaufort
Obama at the General Assembly he used a
speech to say that the United States
would quote re-engage with the United
Nations we have joined the Human Rights
Council we have signed the convention of
the rights of persons with disabilities
we have fully embraced the Millennium
Development Goals and we address our
priorities here in this institution the
main point of his message was that if
the United States was going to work with
the world body it also expected a few
things in return he basically said you
cannot complain that the United States
is going it alone and then sit back and
expect Americans to solve all the
world's problems I took office at a time
when many around the world had come to
view America with skepticism and
distrust he talked about the problems of
nuclear proliferation in Iran and North
Korea in their actions to date the
governments of North Korea and Iran
threaten to take us down this dangerous
slope we respect their rights as members
of the community of nations I have said
before and I will repeat I am committed
to diplomacy that opens a path to
greater prosperity and more secure peace
for both nations if they live up to
their obligations he talked about the
difficulty in solving the Middle East
problem I think that the general
reaction from the Arabs is positive
because he talked about solving the
arab-israeli dispute with a two-state
solution time has come to relaunch
negotiations without preconditions that
address the permanent status issues
security for Israelis and Palestinians
borders refugees and Jerusalem I think
there was a lot of excitement here
because he was here because he has just
such a positive attitude towards the
United Nations the previous
administration although by the end of it
they were using it for all kinds of
things
terms of helping organize elections in
Iraq and Afghanistan they also tended to
denigrate it and to see it as sort of
someplace that was trying to limit
American power you know President Obama
was much more positive you know one sign
of it there's a tradition in the UN that
when F the end of any world leader
speaks then the other leaders can can
get up and go go greet him and you know
the the president of General Assembly
this year was Olivia named Ali tricky
you know tried to sort of say you know
calm down and he it took him like 15 to
20 minutes to get everyone to sit back
down because virtually everyone in sort
of sprung up to go to go shake president
obama's hand after he finished speaking
